Ms. Counts has known metastatic breast cancer and has been on treatment with Fareston and Aredia . On the day she was seen for her regular office evaluation and treatment , she was noted to be very slightly confused , nauseated , vomiting , and dehydrated . She was admitted to the hospital and given intravenous Saline and then Lasix . She was also treated with Calcitonin . During this hospitalization with hydration and diuresis , her calcium fell to normal levels and her renal function corrected to normal . It was felt that the cause of her hypercalcemia is related to progression of metastatic breast cancer and possibly as a flare to Fareston . She was able to tolerate these medicines quite well . In addition , we started her on Taxol 80 mg per meter square with the first dose administered on 01/30/2000 and to be continued as an outpatient . She complained of some pain in her left lower extremity . Deep venous thrombosis was shown by color flow Doppler and she was started on Fragmin and Coumadin during this hospitalization .
